page.title: 20EXPLORERS AT BERE FERRERS
page.content: By now, our Domesday Project is not so much a project but more a way of life. It has been an enjoyable way of life -hard work,but enjoyable. We have made two cheap-day visits to Bere Ferrers by train, a half-day visit to Maristow by coach and have spent three days and two nights on the peninsula which were very worth-while. We would like to thank very warmly all the local people who talked to us so interestingly, the proprietress of the small hotel who did our food shopping for us, the farmer at whose farm we nearly camped and the dear friend-in-need, who arranged for us to stay in the Methodist chapel school room.We have very happy memories of Bere Ferrers and earnestly hope that it stays the way it is now. "We" are the girls of Form One, St Dunstan's Abbey School, Plymouth.
